00021 #ifdef _WIN32
00022 // Windows doesn't seem to have these defined, so we'll define them
00023 // here for utility. Note that with the windows _stat() function all
00024 // users have id 0 and group 0.
00025 #define S_IRUSR 00400 //owner has read permission
00026 #define S_IWUSR 00200 //owner has write permission
00027 #define S_IXUSR 00100 
00028 #define S_IRWXG 00070 //mask for group permissions
00029 #define S_IRGRP 00040 //group has read permission
00030 #define S_IWGRP 00020 //group has write permission
00031 #define S_IXGRP 00010 //group has execute permission
00032 #define S_IRWXO 00007 //mask for permissions for others (not in group)
00033 #define S_IROTH 00004 //others have read permission
00034 #define S_IWOTH 00002 //others have write permisson
00035 #define S_IXOTH 00001 // others have execute permission
00036 #endif

00067 // Return and input buffer.

00069 #define POSIX_CHMOD  _wchmod

00076 #define S_ISREG(m)   (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFREG)

00088 
00090 AptErr_t Fs__stat(const std::string& path,
00091                   struct stat& stat_buf,
00092                   int& rv,
00093                   bool abortOnErr) {
00094 
00095   std::string errorMsg("Fs__stat");
00096   
00097 #ifndef _WIN32  
00098   rv=stat(path.c_str(),&stat_buf);
00099 #else  
00100   WIN32_FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DATA win_attr_data;
00101   rv = 0;
00102   std::wstring unc_wpath = Fs::UncW( path );
00103   if ( GetFileAttributesExW(unc_wpath.c_str(), GetFileExInfoStandard, &win_attr_data) ) {
00104     memset( &stat_buf, 0 , sizeof(struct stat));
00105     if ( win_attr_data.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_DIRECTORY ) {
00106       stat_buf.st_mode |= S_IFDIR | S_IRUSR;
00107       if ( !(win_attr_data.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY) ) {
00108         stat_buf.st_mode |= S_IWUSR;
00109       }
00110     }
00111     else {
00112       stat_buf.st_mode |= S_IFREG;
00113       stat_buf.st_size = (win_attr_data.nFileSizeHigh * (((int)MAXDWORD)+1)) + win_attr_data.nFileSizeLow;
00114       std::fstream fs;
00115       Fs::aptOpen(fs, path,std::ios::in|std::ios::binary);
00116       if (fs.is_open()) {
00117         fs.close();
00118         stat_buf.st_mode |= S_IRUSR;
00119         if ( !(win_attr_data.dwFileAttributes & FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY) ) {
00120           stat_buf.st_mode |= S_IWUSR;
00121         }
00122       }
00123       else {
00124         //std::cerr <<  Fs::MSC_VER_GetLastErrorString("fs.open") << std::endl;
00125       }
00126     }
00127   }
00128   else {
00129     //std::cerr << Fs::MSC_VER_GetLastErrorString("Fs__stat") << std::endl;
00130     rv = GetLastError();
00131     errorMsg = Fs::MSC_VER_GetLastErrorString("Fs__stat");
00132   }
00133   
00134 #endif  
00135   
00136   // @todo decode rv to errnum
00137   if (rv==0) {
00138     return Fs::clearErr();
00139   }
00140   return Fs::setErr(APT_ERR,errorMsg,abortOnErr);
00141 }
00142 
00143 bool Fs__isreadable(struct stat& stat_buf) {
00144   int uid;
00145   int gid;
00146 
00147 #ifdef _WIN32
00148   uid=0;
00149   gid=0;
00150 #else
00151   uid=getuid();
00152   gid=getgid();
00153 #endif
00154 
00155   if ( ((uid==stat_buf.st_uid) && (S_IRUSR&stat_buf.st_mode)) ||
00156        ((gid==stat_buf.st_gid) && (S_IRGRP&stat_buf.st_mode)) ||
00157        (S_IROTH&stat_buf.st_mode) ) {
00158     return true;
00159   }
00160   return false;
00161 }
00162 
00163 bool Fs__iswriteable(struct stat& stat_buf) {
00164   int uid;
00165   int gid;
00166 
00167 #ifdef _WIN32
00168   uid=0;
00169   gid=0;
00170 #else
00171   uid=getuid();
00172   gid=getgid();
00173 #endif
00174 
00175   if ( ((uid==stat_buf.st_uid) && (S_IWUSR&stat_buf.st_mode)) ||
00176        ((gid==stat_buf.st_gid) && (S_IWGRP&stat_buf.st_mode)) ||
00177        (S_IWOTH&stat_buf.st_mode) ) {
00178     return true;
00179   }
00180   return false;
00181 }

00209 AptErr_t Fs::setErrFromErrno(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr) {
00210   return setErrFromErrno(path,errno,abortOnErr);
00211 }
00212 
00214 AptErr_t Fs::setErrFromErrno(const std::string& path,int sys_errno,bool abortOnErr) {
00215   switch (sys_errno) {
00216   case 0:
00217     return clearErr();
00218   case EEXIST:
00219     return setErr(APT_ERR_EXISTS,"exists: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path),abortOnErr);
00220     break;
00221   case EACCES:
00222     return setErr(APT_ERR_ACCESS,"access: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path),abortOnErr);
00223     break;
00224   default:
00225     return setErr(APT_ERR,"generic error: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path),abortOnErr);
00226     break;
00227   }
00228   return setErr(APT_ERR,"generic error: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path),abortOnErr);
00229 }

00237 std::string Fs::osPathSep( const std::string & path ) {
00238   // dont use FSPATH_PATHSEP here as these should be literal strings.
00239 #ifdef _WIN32
00240   if ( path.empty() ) {
00241     return std::string("\\");
00242   }
00243   return Fs::windowifyPath(path);
00244 #else
00245   if ( path.empty() ) {
00246     return std::string("/");
00247   }
00248   return Fs::unixifyPath(path);
00249 #endif
00250   
00251 }

00269 // this is also used to unixify the string-path to our internal conventions.
00270 AptErr_t Fs::unixifyPathInPlace(std::string& str) {
00271   // fix the slashes to go the correct way.
00272   std::replace(str.begin(),str.end(),'\\','/');
00273   return APT_OK;
00274 }

00279   unixifyPathInPlace(tmp);
00280   return tmp;

00285   // flip the slashes.
00286   std::replace(str.begin(),str.end(),'/','\\');
00287   return APT_OK;

00299 std::string Fs::join(const std::string& arg1,
00300                      const std::string& arg2)
00301 {
00302   if (arg1=="") {
00303     return normalizePath(arg2);
00304   }
00305   if (arg2=="") {
00306     return normalizePath(arg1);
00307   }
00308   if (arg1=="/") {
00309     return "/"+normalizePath(arg2);
00310   }
00311   return normalizePath(arg1+"/"+arg2);
00312 }

00316                      const std::string& arg2,
00317                      const std::string& arg3)
00318 {
00319   return join(join(arg1,arg2),arg3);
00320 }

00323                      const std::string& arg2,
00324                      const std::string& arg3,
00325                      const std::string& arg4)
00326 {
00327   return join(join(join(arg1,arg2),arg3),arg4);

00330 std::string Fs::join(std::vector<std::string>& args) {
00331   std::string tmp_str;
00332 
00333   for (unsigned int i=0;i<args.size();i++) {
00334     tmp_str=Fs::join(tmp_str,args[i]);

00336   return tmp_str;

00341 bool Fs::hasTrailingSlash(const std::string& path) {
00342   if ((path.size()>0)&&(path.compare(path.size()-1,1,FS_PATHSEP)==0)) {
00343     return true;
00344   }
00345   return false;
00346 }
00347 
00348 std::string Fs::addTrailingSlash(const std::string& path_in)
00349 {
00350   std::string path_out=path_in;
00351   if ((path_in!="")&&(!hasTrailingSlash(path_out))) {
00352     path_out+=FS_PATHSEP;
00353   }
00354   return path_out;
00355 }
00356 
00357 std::string Fs::trimTrailingSlash(const std::string& path_in)
00358 {
00359   std::string path_out=path_in;
00360   if ((path_out!=FS_PATHSEP)&&(hasTrailingSlash(path_out))) {
00361     path_out.erase(path_out.size()-1);
00362   }
00363   return path_out;
00364 }

00367 
00368 std::string Fs::basename(const std::string& path)
00369 {
00370   // unixify the string.
00371   std::string tmp_path=normalizePath(path);
00372 
00373   // should this be an error?
00374   // no as it makes taking the basename of "" fail.
00375   // we have lots of "foo=Fs::basename(getOpt("foo"))" where foo
00376   // is unset.
00377   //if (tmp_path=="") {
00378   //APT_ERR_ABORT("cant take the basename of '"+tmp_path+"'");
00379   //}
00380 
00381   //
00382   std::string::size_type pos;
00383   pos=tmp_path.rfind(FS_PATHSEP);
00384   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00385     return tmp_path;
00386   }
00387   tmp_path=tmp_path.substr(pos+1);
00388   //printf("Fs::basename('%s')=>'%s'\n",path.c_str(),tmp_path.c_str());
00389   return tmp_path;
00390 }
00391 
00392 std::vector<std::string> Fs::basename(const std::vector<std::string>& paths)
00393 {
00394   std::vector<std::string> out;
00395   out.reserve(paths.size());
00396 
00397   for (unsigned int i=0;i<paths.size();i++) {
00398     out.push_back(basename(paths[i]));
00399   }
00400   return out;
00401 }
00402 
00403 std::string Fs::dirname(const std::string& path)
00404 {
00405   // unixify the string.
00406   std::string tmp_path=path;
00407   unixifyPathInPlace(tmp_path);
00408 
00409   if (tmp_path=="") {
00410     APT_ERR_ABORT("cant take the dirname of '"+tmp_path+"'");
00411   }
00412   if ((tmp_path=="/")||(tmp_path==".")) {
00413     return tmp_path;
00414   }
00415   // a trailing slash is not included.
00416   if (tmp_path.compare(tmp_path.size()-1,1,FS_PATHSEP)==0) {
00417     tmp_path.erase(tmp_path.size()-1);
00418   }
00419 
00420   //
00421   std::string::size_type pos;
00422   pos=tmp_path.rfind(FS_PATHSEP);
00423   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00424     return ".";
00425   }
00426   tmp_path=tmp_path.substr(0,pos);
00427   //printf("Fs::dirname('%s')=>'%s'\n",path.c_str(),tmp_path.c_str());
00428   return tmp_path;
00429 }
00430 
00431 std::string Fs::extname(const std::string& path)
00432 {
00433   // unixify the string.
00434   std::string tmp_path=basename(path);
00435 
00436   //
00437   std::string::size_type pos;
00438   pos=tmp_path.find(FS_EXTSEP);
00439   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00440     return "";
00441   }
00442   tmp_path=tmp_path.substr(pos);
00443   //printf("Fs::extname('%s')=>'%s'\n",path.c_str(),tmp_path.c_str());
00444   return tmp_path;
00445 }

00447 
00448 std::string Fs::noextname(const std::string& path)
00449 {
00450   // unixify the string.
00451   std::string tmp_path=path;
00452   unixifyPathInPlace(tmp_path);
00453 
00454   //
00455   std::string::size_type slash_pos;
00456   slash_pos=tmp_path.rfind(FS_PATHSEP);
00457   if (slash_pos==std::string::npos) {
00458     slash_pos=0;
00459   }
00460   std::string::size_type ext_pos;
00461   ext_pos=tmp_path.find(FS_EXTSEP,slash_pos);
00462   if (ext_pos!=std::string::npos) {
00463     tmp_path.erase(ext_pos);
00464   }
00465   //printf("Fs::noextname('%s')=>'%s'\n",path.c_str(),tmp_path.c_str());
00466   return tmp_path;
00467 }

00469 
00470 std::string Fs::noextname1(const std::string& path)
00471 {
00472   // unixify the string.
00473   std::string tmp_path=path;
00474   unixifyPathInPlace(tmp_path);
00475 
00476   //
00477   std::string::size_type slash_pos;
00478   slash_pos=tmp_path.rfind(FS_PATHSEP);
00479   if (slash_pos==std::string::npos) {
00480     slash_pos=0;
00481   }
00482   std::string::size_type ext_pos;
00483   ext_pos=tmp_path.rfind(FS_EXTSEP);
00484   if ((ext_pos!=std::string::npos)&&(ext_pos>slash_pos)) {
00485     tmp_path.erase(ext_pos);
00486   }
00487   //printf("Fs::noextname1('%s')=>'%s'\n",path.c_str(),tmp_path.c_str());
00488   return tmp_path;
00489 }
00490 
00491 std::string Fs::noextnameN(const std::string& path, int cnt)
00492 {
00493   // unixify the string.
00494   std::string tmp_path=path;
00495   unixifyPathInPlace(tmp_path);
00496 
00497   // no change.
00498   if (cnt==0) {
00499     return tmp_path;
00500   }
00501 
00502   //
00503   std::string::size_type fn_start;
00504   fn_start=tmp_path.rfind(FS_PATHSEP);
00505   if (fn_start==std::string::npos) {
00506     fn_start=0;
00507   }
00508   else {
00509     fn_start+=1; // the first char after the "/"
00510   }
00511   std::string::size_type fn_end=tmp_path.size();
00512 
00513   std::string::size_type tmp_pos=std::string::npos;
00514   for (int n=0;n<cnt;n++) {
00515     //printf("Fs::noextnameN(): str=%d,%d '%s'\n",int(fn_start),int(fn_end),
00516     //       tmp_path.substr(fn_start,fn_end-fn_start).c_str());
00517     tmp_pos=tmp_path.rfind(FS_EXTSEP,fn_end-1);
00518     if ((tmp_pos==std::string::npos)||(tmp_pos<fn_start)) {
00519       //printf("break; tmp_pos=%d\n",int(tmp_pos));
00520       break;
00521     }
00522     fn_end=tmp_pos;
00523   }
00524   //
00525   tmp_path.erase(fn_end);
00526 
00527   //printf("Fs::noextnameN('%s',%d)=>'%s'\n",path.c_str(),cnt,tmp_path.c_str());
00528   return tmp_path;
00529 }
00530 
00531 void Fs::splitPath(const std::string& path,std::string& drive,std::vector<std::string>& parts) {
00532   std::string::size_type s_pos;
00533   std::string::size_type e_pos;
00534   
00535   // clear our outputs before doing work.
00536   drive="";
00537   parts.clear();
00538   clearErr();
00539 
00540   std::string tmp_path=normalizePath(path);
00541   
00542   // split off the drive. ("C:")
00543   if ((tmp_path.size()>=2)&&(tmp_path[1]==':')) {
00544       drive=tmp_path.substr(0,2);
00545       tmp_path=tmp_path.substr(2);
00546   }
00547   else {
00548     drive="";
00549   }
00550 
00551   if (tmp_path=="") {
00552     return;
00553   }
00554 
00555   s_pos=0;
00556   e_pos=0;
00557   while (true) {
00558     e_pos=tmp_path.find(FS_PATHSEP,s_pos);
00559     //printf("  %d-%d = '%s'\n",int(s_pos),int(e_pos),tmp_path.substr(s_pos,e_pos-s_pos).c_str());
00560     if (e_pos==0) {
00561       // an abs path, push "/" as the first value.
00562       parts.push_back(FS_PATHSEP);
00563     }
00564     else if (e_pos==std::string::npos) {
00565       parts.push_back(tmp_path.substr(s_pos));
00566       // and we are done.
00567       break;
00568     }
00569     else {
00570       parts.push_back(tmp_path.substr(s_pos,e_pos-s_pos));
00571     }
00572     //printf("  %d-%d = '%s'\n",int(s_pos),int(e_pos),parts[parts.size()-1].c_str());
00573 
00574     // advance
00575     s_pos=e_pos+1;
00576     if (s_pos>=tmp_path.size()) {
00577       break;
00578     }
00579   }
00580 }

00582 // @todo should have a switch to choose between "noextname1" and "noextname".
00583 std::vector<std::string> Fs::changeDirAndExt(const std::string& new_dir,
00584                                                  const std::vector<std::string>& paths,
00585                                                  const std::string& new_ext)
00586 {
00587   std::vector<std::string> out;
00588   out.reserve(paths.size());
00589 
00590   for(unsigned int i=0;i<paths.size();i++) {
00591     out.push_back(join(new_dir,noextname1(basename(paths[i]))+new_ext));
00592   }
00593   return out;
00594 }

00599 std::string Fs::convertToUncPath(const std::string& str) {
00600   return Fs::convertToUncPath(str,FS_UNC_SHORTLEN);

00602 
00603 std::string Fs::convertToUncPath(const std::string& str,int uncshortlen) {
00604   std::string tmp=str;
00605 #ifdef _WIN32
00606   convertToUncPathInPlace(tmp,uncshortlen);
00607 #else
00608   unixifyPathInPlace(tmp);
00609 #endif
00610   return tmp;
00611 }
00612 
00613 AptErr_t Fs::convertToUncPathInPlace(std::string& path) {
00614   return Fs::convertToUncPathInPlace(path,FS_UNC_SHORTLEN);
00615 }
00616 
00617 AptErr_t Fs::convertToUncPathInPlace(std::string& path,int uncshortlen) {
00618 #ifndef _WIN32
00619   return Fs::normalizePathInPlace(path);
00620 #else
00621   // if the path is less than 260 it can be used as is.
00622   // (lets round down to 220)
00623   // actually lets not do it to make testing better.
00624   // if (out.size()<240) {
00625   //  return out;
00626   // }
00627 
00628   // nothing to do?
00629   if (path=="") {
00630     return clearErr();
00631   }
00632 
00633   // flip the slashes to back slashes...
00634   // do this in case some one joined an already converted path with "/"s.
00635   std::replace(path.begin(),path.end(),'/','\\');
00636 
00637   // now check if it has already been done.
00638   if ( path.substr(0,4) == std::string("\\\\?\\") ) {
00639     return APT_OK;
00640   }
00641 
00642   if (path.substr(0,2) == std::string("\\\\") ) {
00643     path = std::string("\\\\?\\UNC") + path.substr(1);
00644     return APT_OK;
00645   }
00646 
00647   // dont bother converting short paths.
00648   if ((uncshortlen==0)||(((int)path.size())<uncshortlen)) {
00649     return APT_OK;
00650   }
00651 
00652 
00653   std::wstring wsrcpath = Util::toWString(path);
00654   wchar_t wdstpath_char[UNC_MAX_PATH_BUFSIZ];
00655   
00656   // Compute the absolute path. We use the wide char
00657   // version which can handle > MAX_PATH
00658   DWORD rv=GetFullPathNameW(wsrcpath.c_str(),UNC_MAX_PATH_BUFSIZ, wdstpath_char, NULL);
00659 
00660   if (rv==0) {
00661     APT_ERR_ABORT("GetFullPathNameW failed.");
00662   }
00663 
00664   path = Util::toString( wdstpath_char );
00665 
00666   // if there is something there, tack on the "\\?\" prefix.
00667   // so we and windows know this is a UNC path.
00668   if (path!="") {
00669     path="\\\\?\\"+path;
00670   }
00671   //
00672   return APT_OK;
00673 #endif
00674 }
00675 
00677 
00678 std::string Fs::convertCommandToUnc(const std::string& cmd) {
00679   // find the first sep
00680   std::string::size_type pos;
00681   pos=cmd.find(" ");
00682 
00683   // no sep? then no change.
00684   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00685     return cmd;
00686   }
00687 
00688   // split the command into exe and args.
00689   std::string cmd_exe=cmd.substr(0,pos);
00690   std::string cmd_args=cmd.substr(pos);
00691 
00692   // change the command
00693   std::string cmd_exe_unc=Fs::convertToUncPath(cmd_exe);
00694   
00695   // put it back together.
00696   return cmd_exe_unc+cmd_args;
00697 }
00698 
00700 
00701 bool Fs::exists(const std::string& path) {
00702   int stat_rv;
00703   struct stat stat_buf;
00704 
00705   stat_rv = Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00706   if (stat_rv==0) {
00707     clearErr();
00708     return true;
00709   }
00710   //
00711   setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00712   return false;
00713 }
00714 
00715 bool Fs::dirExists(const std::string& path) {
00716   int stat_rv;
00717   struct stat stat_buf;
00718 
00719   Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00720   if (stat_rv!=0) {
00721     setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00722     return false;
00723   }
00724   
00725   if (!(S_ISDIR(stat_buf.st_mode))) {
00726     setErr(APT_ERR,"dirExists(): not a dir",false);
00727     return false;
00728   }
00729   
00730   clearErr();
00731   return true;
00732 }
00733 
00734 bool Fs::fileExists(const std::string& path) {
00735   int stat_rv;
00736   struct stat stat_buf;
00737 
00738   Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00739   if (stat_rv!=0) {
00740     setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00741     return false;
00742   }
00743   
00744   if (!S_ISREG(stat_buf.st_mode)) {
00745     setErr(APT_ERR,"fileExists(): not a file",false);
00746     return false;
00747   }
00748   
00749   clearErr();
00750   return true;
00751 }
00752 
00753 bool Fs::isReadable(const std::string& path) {
00754   AptErr_t rv;
00755   return isReadable(path,rv);
00756 }
00757 
00758 bool Fs::isReadable(const std::string& path,AptErr_t& rv)
00759 {
00760   int stat_rv;
00761   struct stat stat_buf;
00762 
00763   Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00764   if (stat_rv!=APT_OK) {
00765     setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00766     return false;
00767   }
00768   return Fs__isreadable(stat_buf);
00769 }
00770 
00771 bool Fs::isWriteable(const std::string& path,AptErr_t& rv)
00772 {
00773   int stat_rv;
00774   struct stat stat_buf;
00775 
00776   Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00777   if (stat_rv!=APT_OK) {
00778     setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00779     return false;
00780   }
00781   return Fs__iswriteable(stat_buf);
00782 }
00783 
00784 bool Fs::isWriteable(const std::string& path) {
00785   AptErr_t rv;
00786   return isWriteable(path,rv);
00787 }
00788 
00789 bool Fs::isReadableDir(const std::string& path) {
00790   AptErr_t rv;
00791   return isReadableDir(path,rv);
00792 }
00793 
00794 bool Fs::isReadableDir(const std::string& path,AptErr_t& rv)
00795 {
00796   int stat_rv;
00797   struct stat stat_buf;
00798 
00799   Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00800   if (stat_rv!=APT_OK) {
00801     setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00802     return false;
00803   }
00804   if (!(S_ISDIR(stat_buf.st_mode))||(Fs__isreadable(stat_buf)==false)) {
00805     return false;
00806   }
00807   return true;
00808 }
00809 
00810 bool Fs::isWriteableDir(const std::string& path) {
00811   AptErr_t rv;
00812   return isWriteableDir(path,rv);
00813 }
00814 
00815 bool Fs::isWriteableDir(const std::string& path,AptErr_t& rv) {
00816   int stat_rv;
00817   struct stat stat_buf;
00818 
00819   Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false);
00820   // no path.
00821   if (stat_rv!=0) {
00822     setErrFromErrno(path,false);
00823     return false;
00824   }
00825 
00826   // we would like to just write this:
00827   // return S_ISDIR(stat_buf.st_mode)&&Fs__iswriteable(stat_buf);
00828   // but we cant on windows.  Why?
00829   // Sometimes windows has it marked read only, but that is just
00830   // shorthand for "special".
00831   // See http://jira.ev.affymetrix.com:8080/browse/APT-380
00832 
00833   // this isnt a dir, so we fail.
00834   if (S_ISDIR(stat_buf.st_mode)==0) {
00835     return false;
00836   }
00837   // os says it is writeable, so we succeed
00838   if (Fs__iswriteable(stat_buf)==true) {
00839     return true;
00840   }
00841 
00842   // so now it is a dir, but os says it is read-only...
00843 
00844 #ifdef _WIN32
00845   // however... on windows we check to see if we can write to it anyways.
00847   std::string probe_path=Fs::join(path,"Fs-Test-2009323948.tmp");
00848 
00849   if (fileExists(probe_path)) {
00850     APT_ERR_ABORT("Probefile "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(probe_path)+" exists already. It shouldnt.");
00851   }
00852   // try and create the file.
00853   Fs::touch(probe_path,false);
00854   // did it work?
00855   if (fileExists(probe_path)) {
00856     // yep get rid of it
00857     Fs::rm(probe_path);
00858     // and say we did.
00859     return true;
00860   }
00861 #endif
00862 
00863   // unix doesnt lie... we cant write, say we cant.
00864   return false;
00865 }
00866 
00868 
00873 static bool file_starts_with(const std::string& path,const int* magic_bytes) {
00874   std::fstream fs;
00875 
00876   Fs::aptOpen(fs, path, std::ios::in|std::ios::binary);
00877   if (!fs.good()) {
00878     return false;
00879   }
00880 
00881   for (int i=0;magic_bytes[i]!=0;i++) {
00882     if (fs.get()!=magic_bytes[i]) {
00883       fs.close();
00884       return false;
00885     }
00886   }
00887   fs.close();
00888   return true;
00889 }
00890 
00891 bool Fs::isHdf5File(const std::string& path) {
00892   int magic_bytes[]={ 0x89, 0x48, 0x44, 0x46, 0x0d, 0x00 }; // H D F
00893   return file_starts_with(path,magic_bytes);
00894 }
00895 
00896 bool Fs::isCalvinFile(const std::string& path) {
00897   int magic_bytes[]={ 0x3b, 0x01, 0x00 }; // the short calvin magic.
00898   return file_starts_with(path,magic_bytes);
00899 }
00900 
00901 bool Fs::isBinaryFile(const std::string& path)
00902 {
00903   std::fstream fs;
00904   
00905   Fs::aptOpen(fs, path, std::ios::in|std::ios::binary);
00906   if (!fs.good()) {
00907     return false;
00908   }
00909 
00910   int cnt_txt=0;
00911   int cnt_bin=0;
00912   for (int i=0;i<1024;i++) {
00913     int c=fs.get();
00914     // the end?
00915     if (c==-1) {
00916       break;
00917     }
00918     // text?
00919     if (((c>=0x20)&&(c<=0x7E)) // " " -- "~"
00920         || (c==0x09) // "\t"
00921         || (c==0x0A) // "\n"
00922         || (c==0x0D) // "\r"
00923         ) {
00924       cnt_txt++;
00925       continue;
00926     }
00927     cnt_bin++;
00928   }
00929 
00930   // maybe compute some ratio?
00931   double cnt_total=cnt_bin+cnt_txt;
00932   if (cnt_total==0) {
00933     return false;
00934   }
00935   // for now, if there are any, we take the file as being binary.
00936   if (cnt_bin>0) {
00937     return true;
00938   }
00939   // not binary. (Which is not the same as text.)
00940   return false;
00941 }
00942 
00944 
00945 int64_t Fs::fileSize(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr) {
00946   AptErr_t errnum;
00947   int64_t file_size=fileSize(path,errnum);
00948   //
00949   if ((errnum!=APT_OK)&&(abortOnErr==true)) {
00950     setErr(getErrNum(),getErrMsg(),abortOnErr);
00951   }
00952   return file_size;
00953 }
00954 
00955 int64_t Fs::fileSize(const std::string& path,AptErr_t& errnum) {
00956   int stat_rv;
00957   struct stat stat_buf;
00958 
00959   int64_t file_size=-1;
00960   if ((errnum=Fs__stat(path,stat_buf,stat_rv,false))==APT_OK) {
00961     file_size=stat_buf.st_size;
00962   }
00963   return file_size;
00964 }
00965 
00967 
00968 AptErr_t Fs::chmodBasic(const std::string& path,int mode,bool abortOnErr)
00969 {
00970   int rv;
00971 #ifdef _WIN32
00972   // http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb463216.aspx
00973   // This only works at the user level.
00974   // http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1z319a54.aspx
00975   // When both constants are given, they are joined with the bitwise OR operator ( |  ).
00976   // If write permission is not given, the file is read-only. Note that all files are always readable;
00977   // it is not possible to give write-only permission. Thus, the modes _S_IWRITE and _S_IREAD | _S_IWRITE are equivalent.
00978   std::wstring unc_path=Fs::UncW(path);
00979   rv=POSIX_CHMOD(unc_path.c_str(),mode);
00980 #else
00981   rv=POSIX_CHMOD(path.c_str(),mode);
00982 #endif
00983   if (rv!=0) {
00984     return setErr(APT_ERR,"chmod failed. "+FS_ERRNO_STR(),abortOnErr);
00985   }
00986 
00987   return clearErr();
00988 }
00989 
00991 
00992 AptErr_t Fs::listDir(const std::string& path,std::vector<std::string>& names,bool abortOnErr)
00993 {
00994   clearErr();
00995 
00996   names.resize(0);
00997 
00998   if (path=="") {
00999     setErr(APT_ERR_NOTEXISTS,"blank path.",abortOnErr);
01000   }
01001 
01002 #ifdef _WIN32
01003   // We need the "*" to match files.
01004   // This isnt just opening the dir and reading the contents,
01005   // but rather "what matches?".
01006   std::wstring unc_path=Fs::UncW(join(path,"*"));
01007   //
01008   WIN32_FIND_DATAW ffd;
01009   HANDLE hFind = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
01010   DWORD rv=0;
01011 
01012   hFind = FindFirstFileW(unc_path.c_str(), &ffd);
01013   if (INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE == hFind) {
01014     return setErr(APT_ERR_NOTEXISTS,Util::toString(unc_path),abortOnErr);
01015   }
01016 
01017   while (true) {
01018     names.push_back(Util::toString(ffd.cFileName));
01019     if (FindNextFileW(hFind, &ffd)==0) {
01020       break;
01021     }
01022   }
01023   FindClose(hFind);
01024 #else
01025   DIR *d_p;
01026   struct dirent* de_p;
01027 
01028   d_p=opendir(path.c_str());
01029   if (d_p==NULL) {
01030     return setErr(APT_ERR,"osListDir failed. "+FS_ERRNO_STR(),abortOnErr);
01031   }
01032   //int cnt=0;
01033   std::string tmp_name;
01034   while ((de_p=readdir(d_p))!=NULL) {
01035     //printf(" %2d: '%s'\n",cnt++,de_p->d_name);
01036     //
01037     tmp_name=de_p->d_name;
01038     if ((tmp_name==".")||(tmp_name=="..")) {
01039       continue;
01040     }
01041     // add it
01042     names.push_back(tmp_name);
01043   }
01044   closedir(d_p);
01045 #endif
01046 
01047   // return them in order.
01048   sort(names.begin(),names.end());
01049   return clearErr();
01050 }
01051 
01053 
01054 AptErr_t Fs::mkdir(const std::string& path,
01055                    //bool errIfExists,
01056                    bool abortOnErr) {
01057   int rv;
01058 
01059 #ifdef _WIN32
01060   std::wstring unc_path=Fs::UncW(path);
01061   rv=POSIX_MKDIR(unc_path.c_str());
01062 #else
01063   rv=POSIX_MKDIR(path.c_str(), 0777);
01064 #endif
01065   //
01066    if (rv!=0) {
01067      return setErrFromErrno(path,abortOnErr);
01068    }
01069    return clearErr();
01070 }
01071 
01072 AptErr_t Fs::mkdirPath(const std::string& path,
01073                        bool abortOnErr) {
01074   clearErr();
01075 
01076   std::string drive;
01077   std::vector<std::string> parts;
01078   splitPath(path,drive,parts);
01079 
01080   if (parts.size()==0) {
01081       return APT_OK;
01082   }
01083 
01084   AptErr_t tmp_err;
01085   std::string tmp_path;
01086   std::string tmp_drive_path;
01087   for (size_t i=0;i<parts.size();i++) {
01088     tmp_path=join(tmp_path,parts[i]);
01089     tmp_drive_path=drive+tmp_path;
01090     if (!dirExists(tmp_drive_path)) {
01091       tmp_err=mkdir(tmp_drive_path,false);
01092       if (!dirExists(tmp_drive_path)) {
01093         return setErr(APT_ERR,"mkdirPath failed."+FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_drive_path),abortOnErr);
01094       }
01095     }
01096   }
01097 
01098   return clearErr();
01099 }
01100 
01101 AptErr_t Fs::ensureWriteableDirPath(const std::string& path,
01102                                     bool abortOnErr) {
01103   if (!isWriteableDir(path)) {
01104     mkdirPath(path,false);
01105     if (isWriteableDir(path)) {
01106       return clearErr();
01107     }
01108     return setErr(APT_ERR,path,abortOnErr);
01109   }
01110   return clearErr();
01111 }
01112 
01114 
01116 AptErr_t Fs::touch(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr)
01117 {
01118   std::fstream fs;
01119 
01120   Fs::aptOpen(fs, path,  std::ios::in|std::ios::binary);
01121 
01122   // try and open for reading.
01123   if (fs.is_open()) {
01124     // worked so we are done.
01125     fs.close();
01126     return clearErr();
01127   }
01128 
01129   // open for read didnt work, try to write to it.
01130   Fs::aptOpen(fs, path, std::ios::out|std::ios::binary);
01131 
01132   if (fs.is_open()) {
01133     // worked (Which created the file.)
01134     fs.close();
01135     return clearErr();
01136   }
01137 
01138   return setErr(APT_ERR,"touch of "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path)+" failed.",abortOnErr);
01139 }
01140 
01142 
01143 
01144 #ifdef _WIN32
01145 int64_t Fs::getFreeDiskSpace(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr) {
01146   ULARGE_INTEGER lpFreeBytesAvailable;
01147   ULARGE_INTEGER lpTotalNumberOfBytes;
01148   ULARGE_INTEGER lpTotalNumberOfFreeBytes;
01149 
01150   clearErr();
01151 
01152   std::wstring unc_path=Fs::UncW(path);
01153 
01154   if (!GetDiskFreeSpaceExW(unc_path.c_str(),
01155                           &lpFreeBytesAvailable,
01156                           &lpTotalNumberOfBytes,
01157                           &lpTotalNumberOfFreeBytes)) {
01158     setErr(APT_ERR,"getFreeDiskSpaceNative of "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path)+" failed.",abortOnErr);
01159     return -1;
01160   }
01161   
01162   return lpTotalNumberOfFreeBytes.QuadPart;
01163 }
01164 #endif
01165 
01166 #if defined(__linux__) || defined(__APPLE__)
01167 int64_t Fs::getFreeDiskSpace(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr) {
01168   struct statfs retBuf;
01169   clearErr();
01170 
01171   if (statfs(path.c_str(), &retBuf)!=0) {
01172     setErr(APT_ERR,"getFreeDiskSpaceNative of "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path)+" failed. "+FS_ERRNO_STR(),abortOnErr);
01173     return -1;
01174   }
01175   return int64_t(retBuf.f_bavail) * int64_t(retBuf.f_bsize);
01176 }
01177 #endif
01178 
01180 
01181 AptErr_t Fs::rm(const std::string& path,
01182                 //bool errIfNotExists,
01183                 bool abortOnErr) {
01184   int rv;
01185 #ifdef _WIN32
01186   std::wstring unc_path=Fs::UncW(path);
01187   rv=POSIX_UNLINK(unc_path.c_str());
01188 #else
01189   rv=POSIX_UNLINK(path.c_str());
01190 #endif
01191   if (rv!=0) {
01192     return setErrFromErrno(path,abortOnErr);
01193   }
01194   return clearErr();
01195 }
01196 
01197 AptErr_t Fs::rmIfExists(const std::string& path,
01198                 bool abortOnErr) {
01199   if (fileExists(path)) {
01200     return rm(path,abortOnErr);
01201   }
01202   return clearErr();
01203 }
01204 
01206 
01207 AptErr_t Fs::rmdir(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr)
01208 {
01209   clearErr();
01210 
01211   if (path=="/") {
01212     return setErr(APT_ERR,"Wont remove root dir.",abortOnErr);
01213   }
01214   if (!dirExists(path)) {
01215     return setErr(APT_ERR_NOTEXISTS,"does not exist.",abortOnErr);
01216   }
01217 
01218 #ifdef _WIN32
01219   std::wstring unc_path=Fs::UncW(path);
01220   bool rv=RemoveDirectoryW(unc_path.c_str())==TRUE;
01221   if (rv==true) {
01222     return setErr(APT_OK,"",abortOnErr);
01223   }
01224 #else
01225   // posix
01226   int rv=::rmdir(path.c_str());
01227   if (rv==0) {
01228     return clearErr();
01229   }
01231   return setErr(APT_ERR,"rmdir "+FS_ERRNO_STR(),abortOnErr);
01232 #endif
01233   return clearErr();
01234 }
01235 
01236 AptErr_t Fs::rmdirPath(const std::string& path,
01237                        bool abortOnErr) {
01238   if (path=="") {
01239     return clearErr();
01240   }
01241   
01242   std::string drive;
01243   std::vector<std::string> tmp_parts;
01244   splitPath(path,drive,tmp_parts);
01245   
01246   std::string tmp_path;
01247   std::string tmp_drive_path;
01248   while (tmp_parts.size()>0) {
01249     tmp_path=Fs::join(tmp_parts);
01250     tmp_drive_path=drive+tmp_path;
01251     Fs::rmdir(tmp_drive_path,abortOnErr);
01252     if (Fs::dirExists(tmp_drive_path)) {
01253       return setErr(APT_ERR,tmp_drive_path,abortOnErr);
01254     }
01255     tmp_parts.pop_back();
01256   }
01257   
01258   return clearErr();
01259 }
01260 
01262 
01263 AptErr_t Fs::rm_rf(const std::string& path,bool abortOnErr)
01264 {
01265   // try and protect against trival mistakes.
01266   if ((path=="/")||(path==".")||(path=="")) {
01267     return setErr(APT_ERR,"wont attempt to remove "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path),abortOnErr);
01268   }
01269   
01270   if (fileExists(path)) {
01271     return rm(path);
01272   }
01273   if (dirExists(path)) {
01274     std::vector<std::string> names;
01275     listDir(path,names);
01276     for (unsigned int i=0;i<names.size();i++) {
01277       rm_rf(Fs::join(path,names[i]));
01278     }
01279     rmdir(path);
01280     if (dirExists(path)) {
01281       return setErr(APT_ERR,"dir still there.",abortOnErr);
01282     }
01283     return clearErr();
01284   }
01285   //
01286   return setErr(APT_ERR_NOTEXISTS,"rm_rf(): "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(path)+" does not exist.",abortOnErr);
01287 }
01288 
01290 
01291 #if defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__linux__)
01292 bool Fs::isSameVolume(const std::string& path1,
01293                       const std::string& path2,
01294                       AptErr_t& rv,
01295                       bool abortOnErr)
01296 {
01297   int stat_rv;
01298   struct stat stat_buf1;
01299   struct stat stat_buf2;
01300 
01301   clearErr();
01302 
01303   Fs__stat(path1,stat_buf1,stat_rv,abortOnErr);
01304   Fs__stat(path2,stat_buf2,stat_rv,abortOnErr);
01305 
01306   if (stat_buf1.st_dev==stat_buf2.st_dev) {
01307     return true;
01308   }
01309   return false;
01310 }
01311 #endif
01312 
01313 #ifdef _WIN32
01314 bool Fs::isSameVolume(const std::string& path1,
01315                       const std::string& path2,
01316                       AptErr_t& rv,
01317                       bool abortOnErr)
01318 {
01319 
01320   rv = APT_OK;
01321   wchar_t volumeNameBuffer1[UNC_MAX_PATH_BUFSIZ];
01322   wchar_t volumeNameBuffer2[UNC_MAX_PATH_BUFSIZ];
01323   
01324   clearErr();
01325 
01326   std::wstring tmp_path1=Fs::UncW(path1);
01327   std::wstring tmp_path2=Fs::UncW(path2);
01328 
01329   if (!GetVolumePathNameW(tmp_path1.c_str(),
01330                          volumeNameBuffer1,
01331                          UNC_MAX_PATH_BUFSIZ)) {
01332     rv = APT_ERR;
01333     setErr(APT_ERR,"Fs::isSameVolume() - GetVolumePathName() failed.",abortOnErr);
01334     return false;
01335   }
01336 
01337   if (!GetVolumePathNameW(tmp_path2.c_str(),
01338                          volumeNameBuffer2,
01339                          UNC_MAX_PATH_BUFSIZ)) {
01340     rv = APT_ERR;
01341     setErr(APT_ERR,"Fs::isSameVolume() - GetVolumePathName() failed.",abortOnErr);
01342     return false;
01343   }
01344 
01345   //
01346   if ( wcscmp(volumeNameBuffer1,volumeNameBuffer2) == 0 ) {
01347     // now we know they are on the same volume...
01348     return true;
01349   }
01350   // not the same volume.
01351   return false;
01352 
01353 }
01354 #endif
01355 
01356 #ifdef _WIN32
01357 std::string Fs::MSC_VER_GetLastErrorString( const std::string & whence )
01358 {
01359   // Retrieve the system error message for the last-error code
01360 
01361   
01362   LPVOID lpMsgBuf;
01363   DWORD dw = GetLastError();
01364 
01365   FormatMessage(
01366                 FORMAT_MESSAGE_ALLOCATE_BUFFER |
01367                 FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM |
01368                 FORMAT_MESSAGE_IGNORE_INSERTS,
01369                 NULL,
01370                 dw,
01371                 MAKELANGID(LANG_NEUTRAL, SUBLANG_DEFAULT),
01372                 (LPTSTR) &lpMsgBuf,
01373                 0, NULL );
01374 
01375   std::stringstream msgSStr;
01376 
01377   if ( ! whence.empty() ) {
01378     msgSStr << whence << " failed with error " << dw << ": " << (LPTSTR) lpMsgBuf ;
01379   }
01380   else {
01381     msgSStr << (LPTSTR) lpMsgBuf;
01382   }
01383   LocalFree(lpMsgBuf);
01384 
01385   return msgSStr.str();
01386 }
01387 
01388 #endif

01396   fs.open(filename.c_str(), iomode);

01441 
01442 std::string Fs::findLibFile(const std::string &fileName, const std::string &searchPath){
01443 
01444     if(fileName == "") {
01445         // empty string is not valid file name. just return it back
01446         return fileName;
01447     } else if(Fs::fileExists(fileName)) {
01448         // file exists as already specified
01449         return fileName;
01450     } else {
01451         // Now lets search for the file
01452         std::vector<std::string> searchPathVec;
01453         if(searchPath != "") {
01454             // For path separator use ';' on windows.
01455             // Use ':' or ';' on unix.
01456 #ifdef _WIN32
01457           Util::chopString(searchPath,';',searchPathVec);
01458 #else
01459           Util::chopString(searchPath,":;",searchPathVec);
01460 #endif
01461         } else {
01462             char *sp = getenv("AFFX_ANALYSIS_FILES_PATH");
01463             if(sp == NULL) {
01464                 return fileName;
01465             } else {
01466               Util::chopString(sp,':',searchPathVec);
01467             }
01468         }
01469 
01470         for(int i=0; i< searchPathVec.size(); i++) {
01471           if(Fs::fileExists(Fs::join(searchPathVec[i] , fileName)))
01472              return Fs::join(searchPathVec[i] , fileName);
01473         }
01474     }
01475 
01476     // did not find anything, so just return what we started with
01477     return fileName;
01478 }
01479 
01486 void Fs::mustOpenToWrite(std::ofstream &out, const std::string &fileName) {
01487   assert(!fileName.empty());
01488   Fs::aptOpen(out, fileName);
01489   if(!out.is_open() || !out.good()) {
01490     APT_ERR_ABORT("Couldn't open file: " +FS_QUOTE_PATH(fileName) + " to write.");
01491   }
01492 
01493   // Set to throw an exception if something bad happens rather than silently fail.
01494   out.exceptions(std::ofstream::eofbit | std::ofstream::failbit | std::ofstream::badbit );
01495 }
01496 
01501 void Fs::carefulClose(std::ofstream &out) {
01502   // If file is open, do some checks to make sure that it was successful...
01503   if(out.is_open()) {
01504     if(out.bad()) {
01505       APT_ERR_ABORT("Fs::carefulClose() - ofstream bad.");
01506     }
01507   }
01508   out.close();
01509 }
01510 
01515 void Fs::carefulClose(std::fstream &out) {
01516   // If file is open, do some checks to make sure that it was successful...
01517   if(out.is_open()) {
01518     if(out.bad()) {
01519       APT_ERR_ABORT("Fs::carefulClose() - ofstream bad.");
01520     }
01521   }
01522   out.close();
01523 }

01525 
01531 bool Fs::fileCopy(const std::string &in, const std::string &out, bool throwOnError) {
01533   bool success = true;
01534 
01535   std::ifstream is;
01536   std::ofstream os;
01537   std::string iName = in;
01538   std::string oName = out;
01539 
01540   Fs::aptOpen(is, in, std::ios::binary);
01541 
01542   Fs::aptOpen(os, out, std::ios::binary);
01543 
01544   if(!is.good() || !os.good())
01545       success = false;
01546 
01547   os << is.rdbuf();
01548   if(!is.good() || !os.good())
01549       success = false;
01550 
01551   is.close();
01552   os.close();
01553   if(!is.good() || !os.good())
01554       success = false;
01555 
01556   if(throwOnError && !success)
01557       APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to copy file '" + iName + "' to '" + oName + "'");
01558   return success;
01559 }
01560 
01565 static bool _uncheckedFileRename(const std::string &in, const std::string &out, int tries, int sec) {
01566     tries--;
01567     sec *= 3;
01568     bool success = true;
01569 #ifdef _WIN32
01570     success = (MoveFileExW(Fs::convertToUncPathW(in).c_str(), Fs::convertToUncPathW(out).c_str(),
01571                           MOVEFILE_REPLACE_EXISTING|MOVEFILE_WRITE_THROUGH) != 0);
01572 #else
01573     success = (rename(in.c_str(), out.c_str()) == 0);
01574 #endif
01575     if(!success && (tries > 0)) {
01576 #ifdef _WIN32
01577       Sleep(sec);
01578 #else      
01579       sleep(sec);
01580 #endif        
01581       return _uncheckedFileRename(in, out, tries, sec);
01582     }
01583     
01584     return success;
01585 }
01591 bool Fs::fileRename(const std::string &in, const std::string &out, bool throwOnError) {
01592     bool success = true;
01593     success = _uncheckedFileRename(in,out,4,10);
01594   if(throwOnError && !success)
01595       APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to rename file '" + in + "' to '" + out + "'");
01596   return success;
01597 }
